parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: The regional endpoint to use, for example https://eastus.metrics.monitor.azure.com. The region should match the region of the requested resources. For global resources, the region should be 'global'.

post.description: Lists the metric values for multiple resources.

200.description: The response to a metrics query.

default.description: Describes the format of Error response.

x-ms-error-code.description: Error code for specific error that occurred.

ResourceIdList.name: resourceIds
ResourceIdList.description: The comma separated list of resource IDs to query metrics for.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The subscription identifier for the resources in this batch.

StartTimeParameter.name: starttime
StartTimeParameter.description:
The start time of the query. It is a string in the format 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffZ'. If you have specified the endtime parameter, then this parameter is required.
If only starttime is specified, then endtime defaults to the current time.
If no time interval is specified, the default is 1 hour.

EndTimeParameter.name: endtime
EndTimeParameter.description: The end time of the query. It is a string in the format 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffZ'.

IntervalParameter.name: interval
IntervalParameter.description:
The interval (i.e. timegrain) of the query in ISO 8601 duration format. Defaults to PT1M. Special case for 'FULL' value that returns single datapoint for entire time span requested.
*Examples: PT15M, PT1H, P1D, FULL*

MetricNamespaceParameter.name: metricnamespace
MetricNamespaceParameter.description: Metric namespace that contains the requested metric names.

MetricNamesParameter.name: metricnames
MetricNamesParameter.description: The names of the metrics (comma separated) to retrieve.

AggregationsParameter.name: aggregation
AggregationsParameter.description:
The list of aggregation types (comma separated) to retrieve.
*Examples: average, minimum, maximum*

TopParameter.name: top
TopParameter.description:
The maximum number of records to retrieve per resource ID in the request.
Valid only if filter is specified.
Defaults to 10.

OrderByParameter.name: orderby
OrderByParameter.description:
The aggregation to use for sorting results and the direction of the sort.
Only one order can be specified.
*Examples: sum asc*

FilterParameter.name: filter
FilterParameter.description:
The filter is used to reduce the set of metric data returned.
Example:
Metric contains metadata A, B and C.
- Return all time series of C where A = a1 and B = b1 or b2
**filter=A eq ‘a1’ and B eq ‘b1’ or B eq ‘b2’ and C eq ‘*’**
- Invalid variant:
**filter=A eq ‘a1’ and B eq ‘b1’ and C eq ‘*’ or B = ‘b2’**
This is invalid because the logical or operator cannot separate two different metadata names.
- Return all time series where A = a1, B = b1 and C = c1:
**filter=A eq ‘a1’ and B eq ‘b1’ and C eq ‘c1’**
- Return all time series where A = a1
**filter=A eq ‘a1’ and B eq ‘*’ and C eq ‘*’**.

ResourceIdList.description: The comma separated list of resource IDs to query metrics for.

resourceids.description: The list of resource IDs to query metrics for.

AdditionalInfoErrorResponse.description: The response to a metrics query that results in a bad request, with optional additional information.

error.description: Top level error object that contains all relevant information.

type.description: The type of the info property (e.g. string).

info.description: Additional information related to the error.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

MetricResultsResponse.description: The metrics result for a resource.

values.description: The collection of metric data responses per resource, per metric.

starttime.description: The start time, in datetime format, for which the data was retrieved.

endtime.description: The end time, in datetime format, for which the data was retrieved.

interval.description:
The interval (window size) for which the metric data was returned in ISO 8601 duration format with a special case for 'FULL' value that returns single datapoint for entire time span requested (*Examples: PT15M, PT1H, P1D, FULL*). 
This may be adjusted and different from what was originally requested if AutoAdjustTimegrain=true is specified.

namespace.description: The namespace of the metrics been queried

resourceregion.description: The region of the resource been queried for metrics.

resourceid.description: The resource that has been queried for metrics.
